io.hekate.messaging

Interface MessagingChannel<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Base type fo messages that can be handled by channels.
    All Superinterfaces:
    ClusterFilterSupport<MessagingChannel<T>>, HekateSupport

    public interface MessagingChannel<T>
extends ClusterFilterSupport<MessagingChannel<T>>, HekateSupport
    Messaging channel.

    This interface represents a messaging channel and provides API for sending messages to remote nodes.

    Instances of this interface can be obtained via MessagingService.channel(String) method.

    For more details about messaging and channels please see the documentation of MessagingService interface.

    See Also:
    MessagingService.channel(String)

        Returns the cluster view of this channel.

        The returned cluster view contains only those nodes that have a receiver and do match the channel's filtering criteria.

      • send

        SendFuture send(T message)
        Asynchronously sends a one way message and returns a future object that can be used to inspect the operation result.

        This method doesn't assume any response to be received from the destination node. If request-response type of communication is required then consider using the request(Object) method.

        Parameters:
        message - Message to be sent.
        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to inspect the operation result.

      • send

        void send(T message,
          SendCallback callback)
        Asynchronously sends a one way message and notifies the specified callback when the operation gets completed.

        This method doesn't assume any response to be received from the destination node. If request-response type of communication is required then consider using the request(Object, ResponseCallback) method.

        Parameters:
        message - Message to be sent.
        callback - Callback.

      • request

        ResponseFuture<T> request(T request)
        Asynchronously sends a request message and returns a future object that will be completed after receiving the response.
        Parameters:
        request - Request message.
        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to obtain the response.

      • request

        void request(T request,
             ResponseCallback<T> callback)
        Asynchronously sends a request message and notifies the specified callback after receiving the response..
        Parameters:
        request - Request message.
        callback - Callback.

      • stream

        StreamFuture<T> stream(T request)
        Opens a stream for receiving continuous responses.

        This method asynchronously sends a request message, opens a stream for receiving partial replies and returns a future object that will be completed after receiving all responses.

        Notice: this method performs in-memory buffering of all received messages until the last (non-partial response is received.

        Parameters:
        request - Request.
        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to obtain all of the received responses.

      • stream

        void stream(T request,
            ResponseCallback<T> callback)
        Opens a stream for receiving continuous responses.

        This method asynchronously sends a request message and opens a stream for receiving partial replies. For each such reply the ResponseCallback.onComplete(Throwable, Response) method will be called until the last (non-partial) response is received.

        Parameters:
        request - Request.
        callback - Callback.

      • broadcast

        BroadcastFuture<T> broadcast(T message)
        Asynchronously broadcasts the specified message and returns a future object that can be used to inspect the operation result.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to broadcast.
        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to inspect the broadcast operation result.

      • broadcast

        void broadcast(T message,
               BroadcastCallback<T> callback)
        Asynchronously broadcasts the specified message and notifies the specified callback upon the operation completion.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to broadcast.
        callback - Callback that should be notified upon the broadcast operation completion.

      • aggregate

        AggregateFuture<T> aggregate(T message)
        Asynchronously sends the query message and aggregates responses from all the nodes that received this message. This method returns a future object that can be used to inspect the aggregation results.
        Parameters:
        message - Query message that should be sent.
        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to inspect the aggregation results.
        See Also:
        aggregate(Object, AggregateCallback)

      • aggregate

        void aggregate(T message,
               AggregateCallback<T> callback)
        Asynchronously sends the query message, aggregates responses from all nodes that received this message and notifies the specified callback on operation progress and aggregation results.
        Parameters:
        message - Query message that should be sent.
        callback - Callback that should be notified on operation progress and aggregation results.
        See Also:
        aggregate(Object)

      • withAffinity

        MessagingChannel<T> withAffinity(Object affinityKey)
        Returns a copy of this channel that will apply the specified affinity key to all messaging operations.

        Specifying the affinity key ensures that all messages submitted with the same key will always be transmitted over the same network connection and will always be processed by the same thread.

        Load balancer can also make use of the affinity key to perform consistent routing of messages among the cluster node. For example, the default load balancer makes sure that all messages, having the same key, are always routed to the same node (unless the cluster topology doesn't change).

        Parameters:
        affinityKey - Affinity key (if null then affinity key will be cleared).
        Returns:
        Channel wrapper.

      • affinity

        Object affinity()
        Returns the affinity key that was set via withAffinity(Object).
        Returns:
        Affinity key or null, if no affinity is specified.

      • partitions

        PartitionMapper partitions()
        Returns the partition mapper that this channel uses to map affinity keys to the cluster nodes.
        Returns:
        Mapper.

      • withFailover

        MessagingChannel<T> withFailover(FailoverPolicy policy)
        Returns a copy of this channel that will use the specified failover policy and will inherit all other options from this instance.
        Parameters:
        policy - Failover policy.
        Returns:
        Channel wrapper.
        See Also:
        MessagingChannelConfig.setFailoverPolicy(FailoverPolicy)

      • withFailover

        Returns:
        Channel wrapper.

      • failover

        FailoverPolicy failover()
        Returns the failover policy that was set via withFailover(FailoverPolicy).
        Returns:
        Failover policy or null, if no policy is specified.

      • withTimeout

        MessagingChannel<T> withTimeout(long timeout,
                                TimeUnit unit)
        Returns a copy of this channel that will use the specified timeout value and will inherit all other options from this instance.

        If the message exchange operation can not be completed at the specified timeout then such operation will end up the error MessageTimeoutException.

        Specifying a negative or zero value disables the timeout check.

        Parameters:
        timeout - Timeout.
        unit - Unit.
        Returns:
        Channel wrapper.
        See Also:
        MessagingChannelConfig.setMessagingTimeout(long)

      • timeout

        long timeout()
        Returns the timeout value in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        Timeout in milliseconds or 0, if timeout was not specified.
        See Also:
        withTimeout(long, TimeUnit)

      • withLoadBalancer

        MessagingChannel<T> withLoadBalancer(LoadBalancer<T> balancer)
        Returns a copy of this channel that will use the specified load balancer and will inherit all other options from this instance.

        If not specified or set to null then the default load balancer will be used. Default load balancer uses RendezvousHashMapper to route messages if affinit key is specified or uses random distribution of messages among the cluster nodes if affinity key is not specified.

        Parameters:
        balancer - Load balancer.
        Returns:
        Channel wrapper.
        See Also:
        MessagingChannelConfig.setLoadBalancer(LoadBalancer)

      • executor

        Executor executor()
        Returns the asynchronous task executor of this channel.
        Returns:
        Asynchronous task executor of this channel.
        See Also:
        MessagingChannelConfig.setWorkerThreads(int)
